GOLF_PEOPLE.DESCRIPTION: Frontend Development of the Golf People mobile application in the last stage of development prior to launch.

INFORMATICA_CANO.APPOINTMENTS_DESCRIPTION: I developed an appointment management system, with the aim of digitizing the appointment management process of a clinic and facilitating communication with clients by creating a client appointment portal, where depending on the necessary machinery, the establishment, and the employee, it calculates the schedule and available appointments. This system was implemented using Node.js for the backend and Angular for the frontend. My role included planning the software architecture, implementing microservices, and ensuring that the system was scalable and maintainable. One of my notable contributions to this development was the creation of the available appointments search algorithm, considering the schedule of each machine for each establishment, the employee's schedule, and the establishment's schedule, being able to find schedule exceptions, this algorithm calculated the available appointments for a month in a time of 1 to 2 seconds.
INFORMATICA_CANO.DITRAGES_DESCRIPTION: I participated in the development of a new ERP for the company, designed with a hexagonal architecture and following the principles of DDD (Domain Driven Design). This project was implemented using Node.js for the backend and Angular for the frontend. My role included planning the software architecture, implementing microservices, and ensuring that the system was scalable and maintainable. This new ERP was created with the intention of replacing and renewing Gk2Web, and has proven to be a significant improvement in terms of efficiency and usability.
INFORMATICA_CANO.GK2WEB_DESCRIPTION: Billing program aimed at small and medium-sized businesses. Refactoring of complete functionalities such as the creation of expense invoices, development of independent sections from scratch such as a CRM integrated into the program, error fixing and optimization of 'Querys' to obtain accounting listings, managing to optimize some processes by 60%.
INFORMATICA_CANO.REPOSICIONES_DESCRIPTION: I led a three-person development team in creating a logistics management program, serving as both a developer and Scrum Manager. Drawing from my previous experience in ERP development, I planned the software architecture, implemented microservices, and ensured the scalability and maintainability of the program. We utilized Node.js for the backend and Angular for the frontend, adhering to Domain-Driven Design (DDD) principles. The result was an efficient and practical program, providing the company with a tailored solution to its needs and showcasing my ability to lead successful projects.
